etymologies: mid 19th century; earliest use found in American Journal of Science. From German Emplektit, with remodelling of the ending after -ite; so called with allusion to the intimate association of this mineral with quartz at the type locality

definitions: A rare mineral consisting of a sulphide of bismuth and copper, typically occurring as grey or silver-white fibres or needles.

notes.text: Chemical formula: CuBiS₂. Crystal system: orthorhombic.
